inventory.commentary: 12Jun08 - merged senses 1 and 3, revised features, examples, defs. ahouston Includes idioms in_fact, facts_of_life

sense.name: empirical data, information, relevant to a context
sense.examples: The architect gave us the facts and figures on the plans for the new library. The tabloids contain many alleged facts about the romantic lives of movie stars. The lawyers have been reviewing the facts of the case for weeks now. The facts don't support John's belief in a perpetual motion machine. This account of the general's life is not based on fact, but only conjecture and hearsay. The fact that the earth goes around the sun was controversial in earlier times.

sense.name: a state of reality versus fantasy or fiction
sense.commentary: FACT[+state][+circumstance][+reality][-fictional] Note: refers to a whole situation or state that is real, not a collection of supporting information (Sense 1)
sense.examples: Space exploration is now a fact. High infant mortality was a fact of life in medieval times. He lacks the experience for the job and that's a fact. The fact that there will be layoffs next month has caused a lot of anxiety at work. (future state of affairs assumed to be certain to come about)

sense.name: the act of a crime
sense.commentary: FACT[+event][+crime] Note: usage in police and legal investigations
sense.examples: The prosecutor argued that the murderer had dragged the body into the kitchen after the fact. She was considered an accessory after the fact.

sense.name: in truth
sense.examples: In fact, John doesn't have any real friends. The dissidents were, in fact, trying to overthrow their government. Well, in fact, I was thinking exactly the same thing! In point of fact, Mary wasn't his real aunt but just a close friend of the family.

sense.name: sexual reproduction
sense.commentary: Idiom: sexual reproduction Note: idiom is always in the plural
sense.examples: Mary is trying to figure out when to tell her children the facts of life. They are so sheltered that no one ever teaches them the facts of life.
